item.title: Opair Launches ICO for "Open and Fair" Cryptocurrency
item.description:
Opair Launches ICO for "Open and Fair" Cryptocurrency

Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services. Founded by Frank H. Rettig, Opair aims to be a cryptocurrency as well as a platform for crowdfunding, Colored Coins, "decentralized debit cards," private chains, smart contracts, and reputation.

item.title: LEOcoin Foundation Releases Full White Paper for New Token
item.description:
LEOcoin Foundation Releases Full White Paper for New Token

The LEOcoin Foundation has released a full white paper for its digital currency, which details development so far as well as outlining a roadmap for future progress. Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services.

item.title: Why The Windows Secure Boot Hack Is a Good Thing - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Why The Windows Secure Boot Hack Is a Good Thing - Bitcoinist.net

If you even casually follow security news, you're aware that the key governing Microsoft Secure Boot has been found, exploited, and Secure Boot as a "feature" has been rendered meaningless. I'm here to tell you that this is a good thing.

item.title: Swiss Capital Zurich Rejects Bitcoin Government
item.description:
Swiss Capital Zurich Rejects Bitcoin Government

Zurich's local government has gone against initiatives elsewhere in Switzerland by refusing to allow Bitcoin payments of taxes or salaries. Also read: Swiss Town Begins Accepting Bitcoin for Public Services While a similar scheme has proven popular in the city of Zug, an enquiry by two local politicians was met with news that "neither a strategy for Bitcoin use nor preliminary measures" were being looked into in the Swiss capital at present.

item.title: Japan Risks Falling Behind Amid Blockchain Talent Shortage
item.description:
Japan Risks Falling Behind Amid Blockchain Talent Shortage

While the rest of the globe is on pace to grasp this technology in hopes that it could transform financial markets, Japan is lacking specialized technicians to develop their own blockchain industry. Also read:Popular Bitcoin Investing App Keza to Relaunch Japan has a shortage of developers and programmers that specialize in blockchain technology solutions, according to Reuters.

item.title: Mycelium May Roll out P2P Tumbling Soon - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Mycelium May Roll out P2P Tumbling Soon - Bitcoinist.net

There's been no official statements as of yet - but it looks like the Mycelium Wallet will be getting built-in peer-to-peer bitcoin mixing/tumbling later this year. The first testnet transaction from devs went out four days ago, and discussion on internal channels confirms that they're working on integrating P2P tumbling into their popular Android wallet.

item.title: Popular Bitcoin Investing App Keza to Relaunch
item.description:
Popular Bitcoin Investing App Keza to Relaunch

Keza, the mobile app that allows any Bitcoin holder worldwide to invest in stocks and bonds, is to be resurrected after its acquisition by Philippines company Satoshi Citadel Industries (SCI). Also read: Shapeshift Transforms KeepKey Hardware Wallet into an Exchange The move will see Keza developed closer physically to its initial key target market: amateur investors in emerging economies.

item.title: Bitcoin Tech Bootcamp & Milan Conference Vie for Tech Talent
item.description:
Bitcoin Tech Bootcamp & Milan Conference Vie for Tech Talent

A joint Bitcoin Bootcamp featuring teaching from 21 Inc and BitGo will offer just 15 atendees a "comprehensive" technical introduction to Bitcoin October 8-9. Also read: Bitcoin.com's 'Blockchain: Money' Conference is Coming to London The "accelerated 2-day workshop" will be held in Palo Alto, California and focus primarily on exploring the inner workings of Bitcoin and the Blockchain.

item.title: Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News

Bitfinex has Swiss Capital Zurich Rejects Bitcoin Government revealed more information concerning the investigation of the hack that took place on August 2. The exchange explains the company's initial efforts to identify the hackers and the next steps for the business moving forward. The Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex is back up and operational.

item.title: TrumpCoin is Real, But Will It Make Crypto Great Again?
item.description:
TrumpCoin is Real, But Will It Make Crypto Great Again?

A new currency - TrumpCoin - dedicated to supporting Donald Trump's presidency is currently seeking investments as a political action committee (PAC). Also read: Ripple CTO Blasts 'Subtle Tyranny' of Blockchain Hype Support Trump 'Without Giving Away All Your Money' TrumpCoin, which calls itself "the world's first cryptopac," even launched an updated website in its latest incarnation, which features an instructional video on its aims. "Let's make crypto great again," the closing slogan of the video drones.
